intro: Cyrtandra poiensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky areas. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Cyrtandra poiensis is considered a rare and endemic species, highlighting its ecological significance to Hawaii's unique flora.
